title.native: このヒーラー、めんどくさい

description:
The story of the series follows Alvin, a knight with saint-like patience for annoying people, and Karla, a dark elf healer with a sharp tongue and a rotten personality who always speaks without thinking first. Together, they form a party and go on fantastical adventures.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

title.native: このヒーラー、めんどくさい

name.native: マリア・デスフレイム

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

Affiliated with music production group [Heart's Cry](https://anilist.co/staff/252231/). Previously affiliated with PlatinumGames.

Composer, Arranger, Instrumentalist and Lyricist for:
· Astral Chain, NieR:Automata, Xenoblade Chronicles 2, Bayonetta 2, IDOLM@STER: CINDERELLA GIRLS, CHUNITHM, Deemo 2.0, ARCAEA.
· Kamen Rider, Himouto! Umaru-chan, Ghost in the Shell.
· He started his musical career by making EDM and symphonic metal VOCALOID doujin albums, such as Eschatology, featuring Megurine Luka.
Audio and ADR Engineer affiliated with Crunchyroll

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/emilyneves)

Emily Marie Neves is an American voice actress, ADR director and script writer known for her work on English adaptations of Japanese anime shows and films associated with Funimation and Sentai Filmworks/Seraphim Digital. In 2005, she was a preliminary contestant for the fourth season of American Idol at the Las Vegas auditions, where she advanced to the Hollywood round and was eliminated. She was a resident actress at the Alley Theatre in Houston. She was previously married to fellow anime voice actor [Andrew Love](https://anilist.co/staff/96848/Andrew-Love) and was roommates with [Maxey Whitehead](https://anilist.co/staff/103722/Maxey-Whitehead) in college.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/emilyneves)

Emily Marie Neves is an American voice actress, ADR director and script writer known for her work on English adaptations of Japanese anime shows and films associated with Funimation and Sentai Filmworks/Seraphim Digital. In 2005, she was a preliminary contestant for the fourth season of American Idol at the Las Vegas auditions, where she advanced to the Hollywood round and was eliminated. She was a resident actress at the Alley Theatre in Houston. She was previously married to fellow anime voice actor [Andrew Love](https://anilist.co/staff/96848/Andrew-Love) and was roommates with [Maxey Whitehead](https://anilist.co/staff/103722/Maxey-Whitehead) in college.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - In this world where monsters are rampant...
Episode 2 - Forced to travel with Carla, a healer...
Episode 3 - Despite the terrible time he's been having...
Episode 4 - The first dungeon Alvin tackles with Carla is designed for...
Episode 5 - The owner of the inn they visit seems very nice, but...
Episode 6 - As usual, Alvin and Carla have to overcome a series of crises...
Episode 7 - This show is fairly unique in that Carla is the only recurring female character...
Episode 8 - Thanks to Altargaia (reminder: this is the mushroom's name)...
Episode 9 - This episode features even more female guest characters hot on the heels...
Episode 10 - In the second half of this episode, we enter the "What Story Is This?" arc...
Episode 11 - So, this is Part 2 of the "What Story Is This?" arc...
Episode 12 - We've reached the final episode at last...
